item.description:
Need I say more? The Grand Knight of the Franconia Ridge awaits patiently while mere mortals scramble to it's glorious 5,260' summit. While protecting the eastern sky this peak offers magnanimous views in all directions. The ridge is above tree line with exposures in all directions throughout. Afer enjoying the reward we'll take two steps to the left and navigate the up and down ridge trail south to the summit of Mt. Lincoln (5,089) and then to ther little brother Little Haystack (4,760'.) From there we'll descend via the Falling Waters Trail. A magnificent stairway of water back to the parking lot.

Starting Out: We'll meet up at the Lafayette Place Parking lot. It's on the right side of route 93. Easy to miss as you descend around a bend in the road. The lot is about 3-5 miles past the Flume tourist center. The route:

Falling Waters Trail to
Old Bridle Path to
Greenleaf Trail to the summit
Then south on the Franconia Ridge Tail to
Summit of Lincoln and then Little Haystack. Finally, down the Falling Waters Trail to the orthopedic surgen.

About 8.3 miles round trip. Est. hike time about 7.5 hours.

 

Is this Hike For You

This is a moderate to difficul hike. A band of ice has formed at the 3,000' level from the snow melt and freeze cycle. Micro spikes or equivalent equipment will be mandatory on this hike. Extended exposure to the elements over several miles with extensive roots and rocky footing over steep terrain at times.

 

Equipment List

MICRO SPlKES or Equivalent (Mandatory)

3 liters of water

Head lamp

Emergency blanket

Synthetic shirts/pants (a couple of layers for changing temp's)

Rain jacket

Hat, sun screen, sun glases

Lunch and plenty of snacks

Sturdy hiking boots 

 

Liability Waiver

By registering for this hike you acknowledge your own personal conditioning for this hike and assume responsibility to take care under all conditions and not hold RI Outdoors or it's organizers liable for any injuries or misfortune.

 

Car Pooling recommended

Save the planet!
item.name: Lafayette
